52 enum InterpolationScheme {
53  NEAREST_INDEX,
54  LINEAR,
55  EXPONENTIAL
56 };

86 template<typename IndexType, typename DataType, typename FunctionType>
87 class LookupTable
88 {
89 public:

167  void lookup(
168  const IndexType &index, DataType* const p_values,
169  const InterpolationScheme scheme = LINEAR) const
170  {
171  lookup(
172  index, 0, m_num_functions, p_values,
173  Mutation::Numerics::Equals<DataType>(), scheme);
174  }

176  void lookup(
177  const IndexType& index, const int start, const int end,
178  DataType* const p_values, const InterpolationScheme scheme = LINEAR) const

180  lookup(
181  index, start, end, p_values,
182  Mutation::Numerics::Equals<DataType>(), scheme);
183  }

185  template <typename OP>
186  void lookup(
187  const IndexType& index, DataType* const p_values, const OP& op,
188  const InterpolationScheme scheme = LINEAR) const
189  {
190  lookup(
191  index, 0, m_num_functions, p_values, op, scheme);
192  }

222

303 //==============================================================================
304 
305 template<typename DataType, typename OP>
306 inline static void _interpolateNearestIndex(
307  const double &ratio, const DataType *const p_y1, const DataType *const p_y2,
308  DataType *const p_out, const int &start, const int &end, const OP& op)
309 {
310  const DataType* const p_values = (ratio < 0.5 ? p_y1 : p_y2);
311  for (int i = start; i < end; ++i)
312  op(p_out[i], p_values[i]);
313 }
314 
315 //==============================================================================
316 
317 template<typename DataType, typename OP>
318 inline static void _interpolateLinear(
319  const double &ratio, const DataType *const p_y1, const DataType *const p_y2,
320  DataType *const p_out, const int &start, const int &end, const OP& op)
321 {
322  for (int i = start; i < end; ++i)
323  op(p_out[i], p_y1[i] + ratio * (p_y2[i] - p_y1[i]));
324 }
325 
326 //==============================================================================
327 
328 template<typename DataType, typename OP>
329 inline static void _interpolateExponential(
330  const double &ratio, const DataType *const p_y1, const DataType *const p_y2,
331  DataType *const p_out, const int &start, const int &end, const OP& op)
332 {
333  DataType log1;
334 
335  for (int i = start; i < end; ++i) {
336  log1 = std::log(p_y1[i]);
337  op(p_out[i], exp(log1 + ratio * (std::log(p_y2[i]) - log1)));
338  }
339 }

343 template<typename IndexType, typename DataType, typename FunctionType>
344 LookupTable<IndexType, DataType, FunctionType>::LookupTable(
345  const std::string &file_name)
346 {
347  loadTable(file_name);
348 }
349 
350 //==============================================================================
351 
352 template<typename IndexType, typename DataType, typename FunctionType>
353 LookupTable<IndexType, DataType, FunctionType>::LookupTable(
354  IndexType low, IndexType high, int nfuncs,
355  typename FunctionType::DataProvider& provider, double max_error,
356  InterpolationScheme scheme)
357  : m_data_provider(provider)
358 {
359  std::list< std::pair<IndexType, DataType *> > points;
360 
361  // Initialize the list with the bounding points
362  DataType *p_first = new DataType [nfuncs];
363  DataType *p_last = new DataType [nfuncs];
364 
365  FunctionType function;
366 
367  //tableFunction(low, p_first);
368  function(low, p_first, provider);
369  points.push_back(std::pair<IndexType, DataType *>(low, p_first));
370 
371  //tableFunction(high, p_last);
372  function(high, p_last, provider);
373  points.push_back(std::pair<IndexType, DataType *>(high, p_last));
374 
375  // Now add points to the table in order to recursively reduce error
376  populateTable(
377  points, --points.end(), nfuncs, max_error, scheme);
378 
379  // Now we finally have all the points as a list, copy the data into the
380  // class members
381  initialize(points.size(), nfuncs);
382 
383  typename std::list< std::pair<IndexType, DataType*> >::iterator iter =
384  points.begin();
385 
386  for (int index = 0; iter != points.end(); ++iter, ++index) {
387  // Copy index
388  mp_indices[index] = iter->first;
389 
390  // Copy function values
391  memcpy(mp_data + index * m_num_functions, iter->second, m_row_size);
392 
393  // Be sure to free the list storge as we go
394  delete [] iter->second;
395  iter->second = NULL;
396  }
397 
398 }
399 
400 //==============================================================================
401 
402 template<typename IndexType, typename DataType, typename FunctionType>
403 LookupTable<IndexType, DataType, FunctionType>::LookupTable(
404  IndexType low, IndexType high, int nrows, int nfuncs,
405  typename FunctionType::DataProvider& provider)
406  : m_data_provider(provider)
407 {
408  // Initialize table memory
409  initialize(nrows, nfuncs);
410  m_is_constant_delta = true;
411 
412  // Compute the index spacing between table rows
413  const IndexType delta = (high - low) / static_cast<IndexType>(nrows - 1);
414 
415  // Fill the table
416  FunctionType function;
417 
418  for (int i = 0; i < m_num_indices; ++i) {
419  mp_indices[i] = low + delta * static_cast<IndexType>(i);
420  //tableFunction(mp_indices[i], mp_data + i * m_num_functions);
421  function(mp_indices[i], mp_data + i * m_num_functions, provider);
422  }
423 }
424 
425 //==============================================================================
426 
427 template<typename IndexType, typename DataType, typename FunctionType>
428 LookupTable<IndexType, DataType, FunctionType>::~LookupTable()
429 {
430  delete [] mp_indices;
431  delete [] mp_data;
432 
433  mp_indices = NULL;
434  mp_data = NULL;
435 }
436 
437 //==============================================================================
438 
439 template<typename IndexType, typename DataType, typename FunctionType>
440 void LookupTable<IndexType, DataType, FunctionType>::initialize(
441  int nrows, int nfuncs)
442 {
443  m_num_indices = nrows;
444  m_num_functions = nfuncs;
445 
446  m_row_size = sizeof(DataType) * m_num_functions;
447 
448  m_is_constant_delta = false;
449 
450  // Allocate table storage
451  mp_indices = new IndexType [m_num_indices];
452  mp_data = new DataType [m_num_indices * m_num_functions];
453 
454  // Set initial values of all data to zero
455  for (int i = 0; i < m_num_indices; ++i)
456  mp_indices[i] = static_cast<IndexType>(0);
457 
458  for (int i = 0; i < m_num_indices * m_num_functions; ++i)
459  mp_data[i] = static_cast<DataType>(0);
460 } // initialize()
461 
462 //==============================================================================
463 
464 template<typename IndexType, typename DataType, typename FunctionType>
465 void LookupTable<IndexType, DataType, FunctionType>::loadTable(
466  const std::string &file_name)
467 {
468  // Open file for reading
469  std::ifstream file(file_name.c_str(), std::ios::in);
470 
471  if (!file) throw FileNotFoundError(file_name);
472 
473  // Read the table dimensions initialize table data
474  int num_indices;
475  int num_functions;
476 
477  file >> num_indices >> num_functions;
478  initialize(num_indices, num_functions);
479 
480  m_is_constant_delta = true;
481 
482  // Read in each row of the table
483  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_num_indices; i++) {
484  // Read index of row i
485  file >> mp_indices[i];
486 
487  // Ensure that indices are ordered in ascending order and do not repeat
488  if (i > 0 && mp_indices[i] <= mp_indices[i-1]) {
489  throw FileParseError(file_name, i+1)
490  << "Lookup table is not ordered!\n"
491  << "Index of row " << i+1 << " is <= to row " << i << ".";
492  }
493 
494  // Test to see if the change in indices remains constant each row
495  if (i > 1) {
496  m_is_constant_delta &=
497  (abs((mp_indices[i] - mp_indices[i-1]) -
498  (mp_indices[i-1] - mp_indices[i-2])) <
499  1.0e-6 * mp_indices[i-2]);
500  }
501 
502  // Read in the function values associated with index i
503  for (unsigned int j = 0; j < m_num_functions; j++)
504  file >> mp_data[i*m_num_functions + j];
505  }
506 
507  // Close the file
508  file.close();
509 
510  // Write simple message showing that the table is loaded and give its
511  // properties
512  std::cout << std::endl;
513  std::cout << "Loaded lookup table " + file_name + "." << std::endl;
514  std::cout << " min index ~ " << minIndex() << std::endl;
515  std::cout << " max index ~ " << maxIndex() << std::endl;
516  std::cout << " constant delta ~ " <<
517  (m_is_constant_delta ? "True" : "False") << std::endl;
518  std::cout << std::endl;
519 } // loadTable()
520 
521 //==============================================================================
522 
523 template<typename IndexType, typename DataType, typename FunctionType>
524 void LookupTable<IndexType, DataType, FunctionType>::populateTable(
525  std::list< std::pair<IndexType, DataType *> > &table,
526  typename std::list< std::pair<IndexType, DataType *> >::iterator &high,
527  int nfuncs, double error_tolerance, InterpolationScheme scheme) const
528 {
529  const int num_points = 3;
530 
531  typename std::list< std::pair<IndexType, DataType *> >::iterator low = high;
532  low--;
533 
534  IndexType delta = (high->first - low->first) / (num_points + 1);
535 
536  // Loop over potential data points and determine index with maximum error
537  // between interpolated and exact function values
538  IndexType index;
539  IndexType max_error_index;
540 
541  double ratio;
542  double error;
543  double max_error = 0.0;
544 
545  DataType *p_exact_values = new DataType [nfuncs];
546  DataType *p_interp_values = new DataType [nfuncs];
547 
548  FunctionType function;
549 
550  for (int i = 1; i <= num_points; ++i) {
551  // Compute index of this point
552  index = low->first + delta * static_cast<IndexType>(i);
553 
554  // Compute exact values
555  //tableFunction(index, p_exact_values);
556  function(index, p_exact_values, provider());
557 
558  // Now interpolated values
559  ratio = static_cast<double>(index - low->first) /
560  static_cast<double>(high->first - low->first);
561 
562  switch(scheme) {
563  case NEAREST_INDEX:
564  _interpolateNearestIndex(
565  ratio, low->second, high->second, p_interp_values, 0, nfuncs,
566  Mutation::Numerics::Equals<DataType>());
567  break;
568  case LINEAR:
569  _interpolateLinear(
570  ratio, low->second, high->second, p_interp_values, 0, nfuncs,
571  Mutation::Numerics::Equals<DataType>());
572  break;
573  case EXPONENTIAL:
574  _interpolateExponential(
575  ratio, low->second, high->second, p_interp_values, 0, nfuncs,
576  Mutation::Numerics::Equals<DataType>());
577  break;
578  }
579 
580  // Compute error between interpolated and exact values
581  for (int j = 0; j < nfuncs; ++j) {
582  if (std::abs(p_exact_values[j]) < static_cast<DataType>(1.0e-10))
583  error = std::abs(p_interp_values[j]);
584  else
585  error = std::abs(static_cast<double>(
586  p_interp_values[j]/p_exact_values[j]) - 1.0);
587 
588  if (error > max_error) {
589  max_error = error;
590  max_error_index = index;
591  }
592  }
593  }
594 
595  // We can go ahead and free p_interp_values so that memory does not build up
596  // as recursion progresses (note that we cannot free p_exact_values because
597  // it may be used to add data to table)
598  delete [] p_interp_values;
599 
600  // If the max error found in interior points is greater than tolerance then
601  // add that point to the table and repeat for regions on either side of new
602  // point
603  if (max_error > error_tolerance) {
604  index = max_error_index;
605 
606  function(index, p_exact_values, provider());
607  table.insert(
608  high, std::pair<IndexType, DataType *>(index, p_exact_values));
609 
610  typename std::list<std::pair<IndexType, DataType *> >::iterator mid =
611  high;
612  mid--;
613 
614  populateTable(
615  table, mid, nfuncs, error_tolerance, scheme);
616  populateTable(
617  table, high, nfuncs, error_tolerance, scheme);
618  } else {
619  delete [] p_exact_values;
620  }
621 } // populateTable()
622 
623 //==============================================================================
624 
625 template<typename IndexType, typename DataType, typename FunctionType>
626 void LookupTable<IndexType, DataType, FunctionType>::save(
627  const std::string &file_name) const
628 {
629  // Open file for writing
630  std::ofstream file(file_name.c_str(), std::ios::out);
631 
632  if (!file) throw FileNotFoundError(file_name);
633 
634  // Set file format flags
635  file.setf(std::ios::scientific | std::ios::right);
636  file.precision(7);
637 
638  // Write out the table size dimensions
639  file << std::setw(15) << m_num_indices;
640  file << std::setw(15) << m_num_functions << std::endl;
641 
642  // Now write out all of the data
643  for (int i = 0; i < m_num_indices; ++i) {
644  file << std::setw(15) << mp_indices[i];
645 
646  for (int j = 0; j < m_num_functions; ++j)
647  file << std::setw(15) << mp_data[i * m_num_functions + j];
648 
649  file << std::endl;
650  }
651 
652  file << std::endl;
653 
654  // Close the file
655  file.close();
656 } // save()
657 
658 //==============================================================================
659 
660 template<typename IndexType, typename DataType, typename FunctionType>
661 template<typename OP>
662 void LookupTable<IndexType, DataType, FunctionType>::lookup(
663  const IndexType &index, const int start, const int end,
664  DataType * const p_values, const OP& op, InterpolationScheme scheme) const
665 {
666  unsigned int lower_row = 0;
667  unsigned int upper_row = 1;
668 
669  // Search for the indices that bound the lookup index
670  if (index > minIndex()) {
671  if (m_is_constant_delta) {
672  // With constant delta we can use a simple hash function lookup
673  lower_row = static_cast<unsigned int>(
674  (index - minIndex()) / (mp_indices[1] - mp_indices[0]));
675 
676  if (lower_row >= m_num_indices - 1)
677  lower_row = m_num_indices - 2;
678 
679  upper_row = lower_row + 1;
680  } else {
681  // Otherwise do binary search for worst case O(log(n)) comparisons
682  IndexType* p_upper_index =
683  std::lower_bound(mp_indices, mp_indices + m_num_indices - 1, index);
684 
685  upper_row = static_cast<unsigned int>(p_upper_index - mp_indices);
686  lower_row = upper_row - 1;
687  }
688  }
689 
690 // std::cout << "Lookup table: lookup()" << std::endl;
691 // std::cout << "# of indices = " << m_num_indices << std::endl;
692 // std::cout << "x = " << index << std::endl;
693 // std::cout << "index[" << lower_row << "]= " << mp_indices[lower_row] << std::endl;
694 // std::cout << "index[" << upper_row << "]= " << mp_indices[upper_row] << std::endl;
695 
696  // Now compute the values of the functions at index using the specified
697  // interpolation scheme
698  double ratio = static_cast<double>(index - mp_indices[lower_row]) /
699  (mp_indices[upper_row] - mp_indices[lower_row]);
700 
701  DataType *p_y1 = mp_data + lower_row * m_num_functions;
702  DataType *p_y2 = mp_data + upper_row * m_num_functions;
703 
704  switch (scheme) {
705  case NEAREST_INDEX:
706  _interpolateNearestIndex(
707  ratio, p_y1, p_y2, p_values, start, end, op);
708  break;
709 
710  case LINEAR:
711  _interpolateLinear(
712  ratio, p_y1, p_y2, p_values, start, end, op);
713  break;
714 
715  case EXPONENTIAL:
716  _interpolateExponential(
717  ratio, p_y1, p_y2, p_values, start, end, op);
718  break;
719  }
720 } // lookup()
721 
722  } // namespace Utilities
723 } // namespace Mutation
